metadata.title: CVE-2018-15856 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An infinite loop when reaching EOL unexpectedly in compose/parser.c (akathe keymap parser) in xkbcommon before 0.8.1 could be used by localattackers to cause a denial of service during parsing of crafted keymapfiles.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxkbcommon-x11-0 - 0.5.0-1ubuntu2.1
libxkbcommon0 - 0.5.0-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxkbcommon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.0-1ubuntu2.1').
